alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Yakutat; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 13 at 2:43PM AKDT until March 16 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Heavy Snow Followed by Rain for Northern Panhandle... .Snow arrives to the northern Panhandle late Tuesday night through Thursday. Although this is a high confidence precipitation forecast, there is low confidence in timing of precipitation changing from snow to rain as models continue to struggle resolving multiple low pressure systems in the Gulf and associated plumes of moisture. Precipitation will begin as snow, but the uncertainty revolves around how much moisture will be associated with each surge of energy and on how fast temperatures warm. For now, the current forecast represents the lower end of snow accumulation ranges, but there does exist a less than 20 percent probability that snow accumulations could reach the higher end of the forecast ranges. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible. * WHERE...City and Borough of Yakutat, Glacier Bay, Eastern Chichagof Island, Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait and City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect heaviest rates late Wednesday afternoon followed by a change to moderate rain by Wednesday night.
info.instruction: Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
